citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pontibacter (Pon.ti.bac′ter. L. n. pontus the sea; N.L. masc. n. bacter from Gr. neut. n. baktron rod; N.L. masc. n. Pontibacter a marine bacterium).
Rod-shaped cells, motile by means of gliding.
Cytochrome oxidase-, catalase- and alkaline phosphatase-positive.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.

The main cellular fatty acids are straight-chain unsaturated and branched-chain unsaturated fatty acids C15 : 1 iso, C17 : 0 iso 3-OH, summed feature 3 (comprising C15 : 0 iso 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7) and summed feature 4 (consisting of C17 : 1 iso I and/or C17 : 1 anteiso B).
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Pontibacter is a member of the phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Pontibacter actiniarum.
